title: BaŝtoBlog
description:
Free Culture, yay!

“But I don’t want to go among mad people," Alice remarked.
"Oh, you can’t help that," said the Cat: "we’re all mad here. I’m mad. You’re mad."
"How do you know I’m mad?" said Alice.
"You must be," said the Cat, "or you wouldn’t have come here.”

post.title: How to encrypt and share content
post.body:
encrypt with:

      @cmd "aesEncrypt", [unencryptedText], (encrypted) =>
        @log "key: ", encrypted[0]
        @log "iv: ", encrypted[1]
        @log "encrypted text: ", encrypted[2]

generate URL with key:

      url += "#iv:#{encrypted[1]}&key:#{encrypted[0]}"

make sure you get the hashes:

      init: ->
        window.onhashchange = (e) =>
          Page.routeUrl(window.location.search.substring(1),window.location.hash.substring(1))
        @cmd "innerLoaded", true #zeroframe will forward hash then

parse URL with key:

      routeUrl: (url, hash) ->
        hash = window.location.hash.substring(1)
        iv = ""
        if match = hash.match /iv:([^#&]*)/
          iv = match[1]
        key = ""
        if match = hash.match /key:([^#&]*)/
          key = match[1]

decrypt with:

      @cmd "aesDecrypt", [iv, encryptedText, key], (decrypted) =>
        @log "decrypted text: ", decrypted

see http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/

post.title: Now for real
post.body: My blog is now really working, forgot to sign and publicsh /data/users/content.json. From now on it should be possible to like and comment stuff.

post.title: Anonymity
post.body:
We could try to create new private keys for some kind of virtual users (`data/users/virt`). Those keys could be stored in an encrypted file (AES) within the real users directory.

I'm working on an proof-of-concept, not sure if it will work out, I'm low on motivation.

You can give siteSign a custom private key.

https://kjur.github.io/jsrsasign/sample-ecdsa.html
https://www.bitaddress.org/bitaddress.org-v3.2.0-SHA256-ad4fd171c647772aa76d0ce828731b01ca586596275d43a94008766b758e8736.htm

post.title: Distributed Free Culture
post.body:
This blog now states the license without depending on web. The image is hosted directly on the blog. License is distributed via a magnet-link.

Maybe it would make more sense to set up a zite, which hosts all licenses as well as related images.

Next step would be to change ZeroTalk in a way, that it states the used license in every script file as well as in the final all.js.

see https://www.gnu.org/software/librejs/free-your-javascript#magnet-link-license

post.title: Congratulations!
post.body: Your zeronet blog has been successfully created!
